00041 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LNET
00042 
00043 #include <lnet/lib-lnet.h>
00044 
00045 void
00046 lnet_build_unlink_event(lnet_libmd_t *md, lnet_event_t *ev)
00047 {
00048         ENTRY;
00049 
00050         memset(ev, 0, sizeof(*ev));
00051 
00052         ev->status   = 0;
00053         ev->unlinked = 1;
00054         ev->type     = LNET_EVENT_UNLINK;
00055         lnet_md_deconstruct(md, &ev->md);
00056         lnet_md2handle(&ev->md_handle, md);
00057         EXIT;
00058 }
00059 
00060 /*
00061  * Don't need any lock, must be called after lnet_commit_md
00062  */
00063 void
00064 lnet_build_msg_event(lnet_msg_t *msg, lnet_event_kind_t ev_type)
00065 {
00066         lnet_hdr_t      *hdr = &msg->msg_hdr;
00067         lnet_event_t    *ev  = &msg->msg_ev;
00068 
00069         LASSERT(!msg->msg_routing);
00070 
00071         ev->type = ev_type;
00072 
00073         if (ev_type == LNET_EVENT_SEND) {
00074                 /* event for active message */
00075                 ev->target.nid    = le64_to_cpu(hdr->dest_nid);
00076                 ev->target.pid    = le32_to_cpu(hdr->dest_pid);
00077                 ev->initiator.nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00078                 ev->initiator.pid = the_lnet.ln_pid;
00079                 ev->sender        = LNET_NID_ANY;
00080 
00081         } else {
00082                 /* event for passive message */
00083                 ev->target.pid    = hdr->dest_pid;
00084                 ev->target.nid    = hdr->dest_nid;
00085                 ev->initiator.pid = hdr->src_pid;
00086                 ev->initiator.nid = hdr->src_nid;
00087                 ev->rlength       = hdr->payload_length;
00088                 ev->sender        = msg->msg_from;
00089                 ev->mlength       = msg->msg_wanted;
00090                 ev->offset        = msg->msg_offset;
00091         }
00092 
00093         switch (ev_type) {
00094         default:
00095                 LBUG();
00096 
00097         case LNET_EVENT_PUT: /* passive PUT */
00098                 ev->pt_index   = hdr->msg.put.ptl_index;
00099                 ev->match_bits = hdr->msg.put.match_bits;
00100                 ev->hdr_data   = hdr->msg.put.hdr_data;
00101                 return;
00102 
00103         case LNET_EVENT_GET: /* passive GET */
00104                 ev->pt_index   = hdr->msg.get.ptl_index;
00105                 ev->match_bits = hdr->msg.get.match_bits;
00106                 ev->hdr_data   = 0;
00107                 return;
00108 
00109         case LNET_EVENT_ACK: /* ACK */
00110                 ev->match_bits = hdr->msg.ack.match_bits;
00111                 ev->mlength    = hdr->msg.ack.mlength;
00112                 return;
00113 
00114         case LNET_EVENT_REPLY: /* REPLY */
00115                 return;
00116 
00117         case LNET_EVENT_SEND: /* active message */
00118                 if (msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_PUT) {
00119                         ev->pt_index   = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.put.ptl_index);
00120                         ev->match_bits = le64_to_cpu(hdr->msg.put.match_bits);
00121                         ev->offset     = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.put.offset);
00122                         ev->mlength    =
00123                         ev->rlength    = le32_to_cpu(hdr->payload_length);
00124                         ev->hdr_data   = le64_to_cpu(hdr->msg.put.hdr_data);
00125 
00126                 } else {
00127                         LASSERT(msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_GET);
00128                         ev->pt_index   = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.get.ptl_index);
00129                         ev->match_bits = le64_to_cpu(hdr->msg.get.match_bits);
00130                         ev->mlength    =
00131                         ev->rlength    = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.get.sink_length);
00132                         ev->offset     = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.get.src_offset);
00133                         ev->hdr_data   = 0;
00134                 }
00135                 return;
00136         }
00137 }
00138 
00139 void
00140 lnet_msg_commit(lnet_msg_t *msg, int cpt)
00141 {
00142         struct lnet_msg_container *container = the_lnet.ln_msg_containers[cpt];
00143         lnet_counters_t           *counters  = the_lnet.ln_counters[cpt];
00144 
00145         /* routed message can be committed for both receiving and sending */
00146         LASSERT(!msg->msg_tx_committed);
00147 
00148         if (msg->msg_sending) {
00149                 LASSERT(!msg->msg_receiving);
00150 
00151                 msg->msg_tx_cpt = cpt;
00152                 msg->msg_tx_committed = 1;
00153                 if (msg->msg_rx_committed) { /* routed message REPLY */
00154                         LASSERT(msg->msg_onactivelist);
00155                         return;
00156                 }
00157         } else {
00158                 LASSERT(!msg->msg_sending);
00159                 msg->msg_rx_cpt = cpt;
00160                 msg->msg_rx_committed = 1;
00161         }
00162 
00163         LASSERT(!msg->msg_onactivelist);
00164         msg->msg_onactivelist = 1;
00165         list_add(&msg->msg_activelist, &container->msc_active);
00166 
00167         counters->msgs_alloc++;
00168         if (counters->msgs_alloc > counters->msgs_max)
00169                 counters->msgs_max = counters->msgs_alloc;
00170 }
00171 
00172 static void
00173 lnet_msg_decommit_tx(lnet_msg_t *msg, int status)
00174 {
00175         lnet_counters_t *counters;
00176         lnet_event_t    *ev = &msg->msg_ev;
00177 
00178         LASSERT(msg->msg_tx_committed);
00179         if (status != 0)
00180                 goto out;
00181 
00182         counters = the_lnet.ln_counters[msg->msg_tx_cpt];
00183         switch (ev->type) {
00184         default: /* routed message */
00185                 LASSERT(msg->msg_routing);
00186                 LASSERT(msg->msg_rx_committed);
00187                 LASSERT(ev->type == 0);
00188 
00189                 counters->route_length += msg->msg_len;
00190                 counters->route_count++;
00191                 goto out;
00192 
00193         case LNET_EVENT_PUT:
00194                 /* should have been decommitted */
00195                 LASSERT(!msg->msg_rx_committed);
00196                 /* overwritten while sending ACK */
00197                 LASSERT(msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_ACK);
00198                 msg->msg_type = LNET_MSG_PUT; /* fix type */
00199                 break;
00200 
00201         case LNET_EVENT_SEND:
00202                 LASSERT(!msg->msg_rx_committed);
00203                 if (msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_PUT)
00204                         counters->send_length += msg->msg_len;
00205                 break;
00206 
00207         case LNET_EVENT_GET:
00208                 LASSERT(msg->msg_rx_committed);
00209                 /* overwritten while sending reply, we should never be
00210                  * here for optimized GET */
00211                 LASSERT(msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_REPLY);
00212                 msg->msg_type = LNET_MSG_GET; /* fix type */
00213                 break;
00214         }
00215 
00216         counters->send_count++;
00217  out:
00218         lnet_return_tx_credits_locked(msg);
00219         msg->msg_tx_committed = 0;
00220 }
00221 
00222 static void
00223 lnet_msg_decommit_rx(lnet_msg_t *msg, int status)
00224 {
00225         lnet_counters_t *counters;
00226         lnet_event_t    *ev = &msg->msg_ev;
00227 
00228         LASSERT(!msg->msg_tx_committed); /* decommitted or never committed */
00229         LASSERT(msg->msg_rx_committed);
00230 
00231         if (status != 0)
00232                 goto out;
00233 
00234         counters = the_lnet.ln_counters[msg->msg_rx_cpt];
00235         switch (ev->type) {
00236         default:
00237                 LASSERT(ev->type == 0);
00238                 LASSERT(msg->msg_routing);
00239                 goto out;
00240 
00241         case LNET_EVENT_ACK:
00242                 LASSERT(msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_ACK);
00243                 break;
00244 
00245         case LNET_EVENT_GET:
00246                 /* type is "REPLY" if it's an optimized GET on passive side,
00247                  * because optimized GET will never be committed for sending,
00248                  * so message type wouldn't be changed back to "GET" by
00249                  * lnet_msg_decommit_tx(), see details in lnet_parse_get() */
00250                 LASSERT(msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_REPLY ||
00251                         msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_GET);
00252                 counters->send_length += msg->msg_wanted;
00253                 break;
00254 
00255         case LNET_EVENT_PUT:
00256                 LASSERT(msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_PUT);
00257                 break;
00258 
00259         case LNET_EVENT_REPLY:
00260                 /* type is "GET" if it's an optimized GET on active side,
00261                  * see details in lnet_create_reply_msg() */
00262                 LASSERT(msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_GET ||
00263                         msg->msg_type == LNET_MSG_REPLY);
00264                 break;
00265         }
00266 
00267         counters->recv_count++;
00268         if (ev->type == LNET_EVENT_PUT || ev->type == LNET_EVENT_REPLY)
00269                 counters->recv_length += msg->msg_wanted;
00270 
00271  out:
00272         lnet_return_rx_credits_locked(msg);
00273         msg->msg_rx_committed = 0;
00274 }
00275 
00276 void
00277 lnet_msg_decommit(lnet_msg_t *msg, int cpt, int status)
00278 {
00279         int     cpt2 = cpt;
00280 
00281         LASSERT(msg->msg_tx_committed || msg->msg_rx_committed);
00282         LASSERT(msg->msg_onactivelist);
00283 
00284         if (msg->msg_tx_committed) { /* always decommit for sending first */
00285                 LASSERT(cpt == msg->msg_tx_cpt);
00286                 lnet_msg_decommit_tx(msg, status);
00287         }
00288 
00289         if (msg->msg_rx_committed) {
00290                 /* forwarding msg committed for both receiving and sending */
00291                 if (cpt != msg->msg_rx_cpt) {
00292                         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00293                         cpt2 = msg->msg_rx_cpt;
00294                         lnet_net_lock(cpt2);
00295                 }
00296                 lnet_msg_decommit_rx(msg, status);
00297         }
00298 
00299         list_del(&msg->msg_activelist);
00300         msg->msg_onactivelist = 0;
00301 
00302         the_lnet.ln_counters[cpt2]->msgs_alloc--;
00303 
00304         if (cpt2 != cpt) {
00305                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt2);
00306                 lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00307         }
00308 }
00309 
00310 void
00311 lnet_msg_attach_md(lnet_msg_t *msg, lnet_libmd_t *md,
00312                    unsigned int offset, unsigned int mlen)
00313 {
00314         /* NB: @offset and @len are only useful for receiving */
00315         /* Here, we attach the MD on lnet_msg and mark it busy and
00316          * decrementing its threshold. Come what may, the lnet_msg "owns"
00317          * the MD until a call to lnet_msg_detach_md or lnet_finalize()
00318          * signals completion. */
00319         LASSERT(!msg->msg_routing);
00320 
00321         msg->msg_md = md;
00322         if (msg->msg_receiving) { /* committed for receiving */
00323                 msg->msg_offset = offset;
00324                 msg->msg_wanted = mlen;
00325         }
00326 
00327         md->md_refcount++;
00328         if (md->md_threshold != LNET_MD_THRESH_INF) {
00329                 LASSERT(md->md_threshold > 0);
00330                 md->md_threshold--;
00331         }
00332 
00333         /* build umd in event */
00334         lnet_md2handle(&msg->msg_ev.md_handle, md);
00335         lnet_md_deconstruct(md, &msg->msg_ev.md);
00336 }
00337 
00338 void
00339 lnet_msg_detach_md(lnet_msg_t *msg, int status)
00340 {
00341         lnet_libmd_t    *md = msg->msg_md;
00342         int             unlink;
00343 
00344         /* Now it's safe to drop my caller's ref */
00345         md->md_refcount--;
00346         LASSERT(md->md_refcount >= 0);
00347 
00348         unlink = lnet_md_unlinkable(md);
00349         if (md->md_eq != NULL) {
00350                 msg->msg_ev.status   = status;
00351                 msg->msg_ev.unlinked = unlink;
00352                 lnet_eq_enqueue_event(md->md_eq, &msg->msg_ev);
00353         }
00354 
00355         if (unlink)
00356                 lnet_md_unlink(md);
00357 
00358         msg->msg_md = NULL;
00359 }
00360 
00361 static int
00362 lnet_complete_msg_locked(lnet_msg_t *msg, int cpt)
00363 {
00364         lnet_handle_wire_t ack_wmd;
00365         int                rc;
00366         int                status = msg->msg_ev.status;
00367 
00368         LASSERT(msg->msg_onactivelist);
00369 
00370         if (status == 0 && msg->msg_ack) {
00371                 /* Only send an ACK if the PUT completed successfully */
00372 
00373                 lnet_msg_decommit(msg, cpt, 0);
00374 
00375                 msg->msg_ack = 0;
00376                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00377 
00378                 LASSERT(msg->msg_ev.type == LNET_EVENT_PUT);
00379                 LASSERT(!msg->msg_routing);
00380 
00381                 ack_wmd = msg->msg_hdr.msg.put.ack_wmd;
00382 
00383                 lnet_prep_send(msg, LNET_MSG_ACK, msg->msg_ev.initiator, 0, 0);
00384 
00385                 msg->msg_hdr.msg.ack.dst_wmd = ack_wmd;
00386                 msg->msg_hdr.msg.ack.match_bits = msg->msg_ev.match_bits;
00387                 msg->msg_hdr.msg.ack.mlength = cpu_to_le32(msg->msg_ev.mlength);
00388 
00389                 /* NB: we probably want to use NID of msg::msg_from as 3rd
00390                  * parameter (router NID) if it's routed message */
00391                 rc = lnet_send(msg->msg_ev.target.nid, msg, LNET_NID_ANY);
00392 
00393                 lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00394                 /*
00395                  * NB: message is committed for sending, we should return
00396                  * on success because LND will finalize this message later.
00397                  *
00398                  * Also, there is possibility that message is committed for
00399                  * sending and also failed before delivering to LND,
00400                  * i.e: ENOMEM, in that case we can't fall through either
00401                  * because CPT for sending can be different with CPT for
00402                  * receiving, so we should return back to lnet_finalize()
00403                  * to make sure we are locking the correct partition.
00404                  */
00405                 return rc;
00406 
00407         } else if (status == 0 &&       /* OK so far */
00408                    (msg->msg_routing && !msg->msg_sending)) {
00409                 /* not forwarded */
00410                 LASSERT(!msg->msg_receiving);   /* called back recv already */
00411                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00412 
00413                 rc = lnet_send(LNET_NID_ANY, msg, LNET_NID_ANY);
00414 
00415                 lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00416                 /*
00417                  * NB: message is committed for sending, we should return
00418                  * on success because LND will finalize this message later.
00419                  *
00420                  * Also, there is possibility that message is committed for
00421                  * sending and also failed before delivering to LND,
00422                  * i.e: ENOMEM, in that case we can't fall through either:
00423                  * - The rule is message must decommit for sending first if
00424                  *   the it's committed for both sending and receiving
00425                  * - CPT for sending can be different with CPT for receiving,
00426                  *   so we should return back to lnet_finalize() to make
00427                  *   sure we are locking the correct partition.
00428                  */
00429                 return rc;
00430         }
00431 
00432         lnet_msg_decommit(msg, cpt, status);
00433         lnet_msg_free(msg);
00434         return 0;
00435 }
00436 
00437 void
00438 lnet_finalize(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg, int status)
00439 {
00440         struct lnet_msg_container       *container;
00441         int                             my_slot;
00442         int                             cpt;
00443         int                             rc;
00444         int                             i;
00445 
00446         LASSERT(!in_interrupt());
00447 
00448         if (msg == NULL)
00449                 return;
00450 #if 0
00451         CDEBUG(D_WARNING, "%s msg->%s Flags:%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s txp %s rxp %s\n",
00452                lnet_msgtyp2str(msg->msg_type), libcfs_id2str(msg->msg_target),
00453                msg->msg_target_is_router ? "t" : "",
00454                msg->msg_routing ? "X" : "",
00455                msg->msg_ack ? "A" : "",
00456                msg->msg_sending ? "S" : "",
00457                msg->msg_receiving ? "R" : "",
00458                msg->msg_delayed ? "d" : "",
00459                msg->msg_txcredit ? "C" : "",
00460                msg->msg_peertxcredit ? "c" : "",
00461                msg->msg_rtrcredit ? "F" : "",
00462                msg->msg_peerrtrcredit ? "f" : "",
00463                msg->msg_onactivelist ? "!" : "",
00464                msg->msg_txpeer == NULL ? "<none>" : libcfs_nid2str(msg->msg_txpeer->lp_nid),
00465                msg->msg_rxpeer == NULL ? "<none>" : libcfs_nid2str(msg->msg_rxpeer->lp_nid));
00466 #endif
00467         msg->msg_ev.status = status;
00468 
00469         if (msg->msg_md != NULL) {
00470                 cpt = lnet_cpt_of_cookie(msg->msg_md->md_lh.lh_cookie);
00471 
00472                 lnet_res_lock(cpt);
00473                 lnet_msg_detach_md(msg, status);
00474                 lnet_res_unlock(cpt);
00475         }
00476 
00477  again:
00478         rc = 0;
00479         if (!msg->msg_tx_committed && !msg->msg_rx_committed) {
00480                 /* not committed to network yet */
00481                 LASSERT(!msg->msg_onactivelist);
00482                 lnet_msg_free(msg);
00483                 return;
00484         }
00485 
00486         /*
00487          * NB: routed message can be committed for both receiving and sending,
00488          * we should finalize in LIFO order and keep counters correct.
00489          * (finalize sending first then finalize receiving)
00490          */
00491         cpt = msg->msg_tx_committed ? msg->msg_tx_cpt : msg->msg_rx_cpt;
00492         lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00493 
00494         container = the_lnet.ln_msg_containers[cpt];
00495         list_add_tail(&msg->msg_list, &container->msc_finalizing);
00496 
00497         /* Recursion breaker.  Don't complete the message here if I am (or
00498          * enough other threads are) already completing messages */
00499 
00500         my_slot = -1;
00501         for (i = 0; i < container->msc_nfinalizers; i++) {
00502                 if (container->msc_finalizers[i] == current)
00503                         break;
00504 
00505                 if (my_slot < 0 && container->msc_finalizers[i] == NULL)
00506                         my_slot = i;
00507         }
00508 
00509         if (i < container->msc_nfinalizers || my_slot < 0) {
00510                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00511                 return;
00512         }
00513 
00514         container->msc_finalizers[my_slot] = current;
00515 
00516         while (!list_empty(&container->msc_finalizing)) {
00517                 msg = list_entry(container->msc_finalizing.next,
00518                                  lnet_msg_t, msg_list);
00519 
00520                 list_del(&msg->msg_list);
00521 
00522                 /* NB drops and regains the lnet lock if it actually does
00523                  * anything, so my finalizing friends can chomp along too */
00524                 rc = lnet_complete_msg_locked(msg, cpt);
00525                 if (rc != 0)
00526                         break;
00527         }
00528 
00529         if (unlikely(!list_empty(&the_lnet.ln_delay_rules))) {
00530                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00531                 lnet_delay_rule_check();
00532                 lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00533         }
00534 
00535         container->msc_finalizers[my_slot] = NULL;
00536         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00537 
00538         if (rc != 0)
00539                 goto again;
00540 }
00541 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_finalize);
00542 
00543 void
00544 lnet_msg_container_cleanup(struct lnet_msg_container *container)
00545 {
00546         int     count = 0;
00547 
00548         if (container->msc_init == 0)
00549                 return;
00550 
00551         while (!list_empty(&container->msc_active)) {
00552                 lnet_msg_t *msg = list_entry(container->msc_active.next,
00553                                              lnet_msg_t, msg_activelist);
00554 
00555                 LASSERT(msg->msg_onactivelist);
00556                 msg->msg_onactivelist = 0;
00557                 list_del(&msg->msg_activelist);
00558                 lnet_msg_free(msg);
00559                 count++;
00560         }
00561 
00562         if (count > 0)
00563                 CERROR("%d active msg on exit\n", count);
00564 
00565         if (container->msc_finalizers != NULL) {
00566                 LIBCFS_FREE(container->msc_finalizers,
00567                             container->msc_nfinalizers *
00568                             sizeof(*container->msc_finalizers));
00569                 container->msc_finalizers = NULL;
00570         }
00571         container->msc_init = 0;
00572 }
00573 
00574 int
00575 lnet_msg_container_setup(struct lnet_msg_container *container, int cpt)
00576 {
00577         int     rc;
00578 
00579         container->msc_init = 1;
00580 
00581         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&container->msc_active);
00582         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&container->msc_finalizing);
00583 
00584         rc = 0;
00585         /* number of CPUs */
00586         container->msc_nfinalizers = cfs_cpt_weight(lnet_cpt_table(), cpt);
00587 
00588         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(container->msc_finalizers, lnet_cpt_table(), cpt,
00589                          container->msc_nfinalizers *
00590                          sizeof(*container->msc_finalizers));
00591 
00592         if (container->msc_finalizers == NULL) {
00593                 CERROR("Failed to allocate message finalizers\n");
00594                 lnet_msg_container_cleanup(container);
00595                 return -ENOMEM;
00596         }
00597 
00598         return rc;
00599 }
00600 
00601 void
00602 lnet_msg_containers_destroy(void)
00603 {
00604         struct lnet_msg_container *container;
00605         int     i;
00606 
00607         if (the_lnet.ln_msg_containers == NULL)
00608                 return;
00609 
00610         cfs_percpt_for_each(container, i, the_lnet.ln_msg_containers)
00611                 lnet_msg_container_cleanup(container);
00612 
00613         cfs_percpt_free(the_lnet.ln_msg_containers);
00614         the_lnet.ln_msg_containers = NULL;
00615 }
00616 
00617 int
00618 lnet_msg_containers_create(void)
00619 {
00620         struct lnet_msg_container *container;
00621         int     rc;
00622         int     i;
00623 
00624         the_lnet.ln_msg_containers = cfs_percpt_alloc(lnet_cpt_table(),
00625                                                       sizeof(*container));
00626 
00627         if (the_lnet.ln_msg_containers == NULL) {
00628                 CERROR("Failed to allocate cpu-partition data for network\n");
00629                 return -ENOMEM;
00630         }
00631 
00632         cfs_percpt_for_each(container, i, the_lnet.ln_msg_containers) {
00633                 rc = lnet_msg_container_setup(container, i);
00634                 if (rc != 0) {
00635                         lnet_msg_containers_destroy();
00636                         return rc;
00637                 }
00638         }
00639 
00640         return 0;
00641 }
